One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 20 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 14: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 15: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 16: Available cues A. You chose A and saw RED.
Round 17: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 18: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 19: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 20: Available cues A. You chose A and saw RED.

----------------------------------------

One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 20 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 2: Available cues A, B. You chose A and saw RED.
Round 3: Available cues A, B. You chose A and saw RED.
Round 4: Available cues A. You chose A and saw RED.
Round 5: Available cues B. You chose A and saw Invalid choice.
Round 6: Available cues A. You chose A and saw GREEN.
Round 7: Available cues A. You chose A and saw GREEN.
Round 8: Available cues B. You chose A and saw Invalid choice.

One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 20 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.

Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution

=== Simulation 42 ===
Correct quadrant: 1
LLM choice: 2
Success: False

=== Complete Conversation Log ===

INITIAL_DESCRIPTION:
----------------------------------------
You will play a game with 20 rounds.
In each round you'll see active cues (chooseable):
One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 20 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.

Round 15: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 16: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 17: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 18: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw GREEN.
Round 19: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 20: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.

One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 20 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.

One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 20 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues A. You chose B and saw Invalid choice.
Round 2: Available cues A. You chose A and saw RED.

Round 19: Available cues A. You chose A and saw RED.
Round 20: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw GREEN.

Round 19: Available cues A, B. You chose A and saw GREEN.
Round 20: Available cues A. You chose A and saw RED.

INITIAL_DESCRIPTION:

One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 20 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 2: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 3: Available cues A, B. Based on previous observations, choose one cue by responding with just the letter. You press <<
----------------------------------------

LLM_CHOICE:
----------------------------------------
B
----------------------------------------

RESULT:
----------------------------------------
GREEN

FINAL_ACCUMULATED_PROMPT:
----------------------------------------
You will play a game with 20 rounds.
In each round you'll see active cues (chooseable):
One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 20 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 2: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 3: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw GREEN.
Round 4: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 5: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 6: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 7: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 8: Available cues B. You chose B and saw GREEN.
Round 9: Available cues A. You chose B and saw Invalid choice.
Round 10: Available cues A, B. You chose A and saw RED.
Round 11: Available cues B. You chose B and saw GREEN.
Round 12: Available cues A. You chose B and saw Invalid choice.
Round 13: Available cues B. You chose B and saw GREEN.
Round 14: Available cues B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 15: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 16: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 17: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw GREEN.
Round 18: Available cues A, B. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 19: Available cues A. You chose B and saw Invalid choice.
Round 20: Available cues B. You chose B and saw GREEN.
Based on all observed colors, which quadrant (1, 2) do you think had the highest ratio of RED? Respond with just the number. You choose <<
----------------------------------------

FINAL_CHOICE:
----------------------------------------
2
----------------------------------------
